metalign.time

Class TimeTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • metalign.time.TimeTracker
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FromOutputTimeTracker, NoteBTimeTracker

    public class TimeTracker
extends java.lang.Object
    A TimeTracker is able to interpret MIDI tempo, key, and time signature change events and keep track of the song timing in seconds, instead of just using ticks as MIDI events do. It does this by using a LinkedList of TimeTrackerNode objects.
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 23 October, 2014

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int anacrusisLength
      The number of ticks which lie before the first full measure in this song.

      The last tick for any event in this song, initially 0.
      private java.util.LinkedList<TimeTrackerNode> nodes
      The LInkedList of TimeTrackerNodes of this TimeTracker, ordered by time.
      private double PPQ
      Pulses (ticks) per Quarter note, as in the current Midi song's header.
      protected int subBeatLength
      The number of tatums per sub beat.

    • Field Detail

      • PPQ

        private double PPQ
        Pulses (ticks) per Quarter note, as in the current Midi song's header.

      • nodes

        private final java.util.LinkedList<TimeTrackerNode> nodes
        The LInkedList of TimeTrackerNodes of this TimeTracker, ordered by time.

      • subBeatLength

        protected int subBeatLength
        The number of tatums per sub beat. A negative value or 0 defaults to using 32nd notes.

      • anacrusisLength

        private int anacrusisLength
        The number of ticks which lie before the first full measure in this song.

      • lastTick

        private long lastTick
        The last tick for any event in this song, initially 0.

      • getBeatsOnly

        public java.util.List<Beat> getBeatsOnly()

      • fixBeatsGivenSubBeatLength

        private java.util.List<Beat> fixBeatsGivenSubBeatLength(java.util.List<Beat> oldBeats)
        Fix the given Beats List based on the set subBeatLength. That is, remove or add tacti as needed to get the desired number of tacti per sub beat.
        Parameters:
        oldBeats - The old Beat List.
        Returns:
        The new, fixed Beat List.

      • getQuantizationError

        public double getQuantizationError(MidiNote note,
                                   int divisions)
        Get the quantization error of the given note, with the given number of divisions per quarter note.
        Parameters:
        note - The note whose quantization error we want.
        divisions - The number of divisions per quarter note.
        Returns:
        The quantization error of the given note's onset, as a percentage of the quarter note length.
